summary:
Versatile Executive with extensive cross border experience in new & sustainable business transformation in the utilities & environmental sector

Hands-on executive that wants to leave a legacy.

Is passionate about making business a driver to a new economy and a sustainable world.

Gives purpose, energy and direction to multi stakeholder teams. Has vision and implements. Identifies trends and growth opportunities. Reduces complexity, builds trust, mobilizes teams, initiates partnerships.  Knows how to move the regulatory environment forward. Extensive (EU) network. Strong interface between public & private actors. Reaching results is important. Acts as a Sherpa in realizing ambitious & realistic objectives. Branch and company think tank, appreciated participant in multiple business networks, lecturer, author, moderator and presenter in international setting. 

Results over time include technical projects like the design of the largest Dutch submerged tunnel, project manager of “pressure cooker" river embankment reconstruction after major floods and 200 M € project development of waste incinerators

Results involve a.o. revitalizing a BU of 100 FTE as a manager or giving direction to and building a market leader reputation for a SUEZ Environnement (SE) BU of 8500 FTE. It also includes multi-million € cross border contract coordination and setting up award winning sustainability reports.

More subtle results concern art of lobbying for regulation like the 10-year packaging agreement (NL) NL or the Waste Framework Directive (EU). Active as a Sherpa for the EIP on Raw Materials (EU) and pushing forward the concept of the Circular Economy as a business opportunity.

Skills: Strategy, Public Affairs, (Regulatory) Business Development, Storytelling 

Expertise topics: Circular Economy, Waste Management, Resource Efficiency, Smart City  Solutions

Freek van Eijk has one daughter and speaks 5 languages. In his spare time he likes traveling, outdoor sports and photography.

projects:
[{'title': 'First International Green Deal: "the North Sea Resources Roundabout"', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'On 3 March 2016 parties, including 6 ministers from four countries,  signed the Green Deal for a North Sea Resources Roundabout. The aim is to facilitate the free movement of secondary materials, not through new legislation, but in a bottom-up process of harmonisation. The European Commission is enthusiastic and the Netherlands has another sustainability showpiece. The process from idea to signing took 1 year and 1 day and was initiated by Acceleratio.

Good background reading can be found on: http://www.wastematters.eu/news-from-europe/news-from-europe/north-sea-countries-agree-to-close-cross-border-value-chains.html

The formal green deal text can be found on: http://www.greendeals.nl/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/International-Green-Deal-text-NSRR.pdf

A video can be found on: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tb7Poc2CcOM&feature=youtu.be', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Freek', 'last_name': 'van Eijk', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Holland Circular Hotspot'}]}, {'title': 'Circular Europe Days Dubai Expo', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'description': "On 17 and 18 January 2022, the ECESP Coordination Group presented Europe's pioneering work done by its Leadership groups in the field of the circular economy before a global audience at the Circular Europe Days in Dubai.

The role of the 24-member Coordination Group is to implement the ECESP objectives and foster the debate on circularity. They lead dialogue on the ground and Europe-wide on top circular issues within thematic working groups known as Leadership groups.

The Circular Europe Days took place during Dubai Expo Global Goals Week, coinciding with Abu Dhabi Sustainability Week, and attracted an international audience including high-level state representatives.

The programme was rich and varied and covered various themes, such as buildings and infrastructure, circular procurement, electronics, economic incentives, food waste and more. European Commissioners, Members of the European Parliament and representatives of the European institutions' highest levels, have joined the event to present Europe's vision for the circular economy.

Five Member States (Ireland, Slovenia, the Netherlands, Poland and Finland) hosted the Circular Europe Days in their pavilions, highlighting national efforts to transition towards the circular economy.

There were matchmaking opportunities, supported by the Enterprise Europe Network, for businesses onsite and online to facilitate collaboration, urging further action towards a sustainable and inclusive future. For six days, you can book meetings with circular economy stakeholders from all over the world!

For the first two days (17-18 January) the meetings was hybrid: onsite for the people in Dubai and online for the others. From 19-22 January, the matchmaking was 24/7 online for all participants. The matchmaking event was free and open to all participants joining the Dubai EXPO, participating in missions and other organisations in the world, and active in the circular economy.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Freek', 'last_name': 'van Eijk', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Holland Circular Hotspot'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Anca', 'last_name': 'Turtoi', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Operations Manager at Holland Circular Hotspot'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Ladeja', 'last_name': 'Godina Košir', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Founder and Executive Director at Circular Change & Co-chair of CG ECESP'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Eva', 'last_name': 'Nedelkova', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Transforming ESG into strategic opportunity I Co-Founder at KnowESG I ESG Non-executive Director, Board Member & Advisor'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Janine', 'last_name': 'B.', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Head of Unit, Relations with Civil Society & National ESCs'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Mohini', 'last_name': 'Keunen', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Helping companies innovate and grow internationally, integrating Circular Economy-Sustainability - Professional Bharata Natyam Dancer/ Yoga trainer'}]}, {'title': 'Getting the United Nations to fund Waste Management & Recycling', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'description': "Successful lobby effort started by ISWA after the Climate Change summit in Copenhagen (December 2009) to make sure investments in sustainable waste management and recycling in developing economies will be covered for funding out of the annual budgets to mitigate climate change. In the UN Durban accords on Climate Change in December 2011 the sector of waste management and recycling was formally recognised. I acted as the Special Delegate on behalf of SUEZ Environnement, one of the world's leading Waste Management companies, to support the ISWA mission and co-delivered the final presentation at the Climate Conference in Durban.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Freek', 'last_name': 'van Eijk', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Director at Holland Circular Hotspot'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Erik', 'last_name': 'de Baedts', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Consultant and Speaker, with faith in cooperation for a better, just and tolerant world with a sustainable climate'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'David Robert', 'last_name': 'Newman  FCIWM', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Managing Director at BBIA, Chairman of the European Bioeconomy Bureau'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Gary', 'last_name': 'Crawford', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Vice President - International Affairs at Veolia'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Gerfried', 'last_name': 'Habenicht', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Policy Advisor at Austrian Federal Economic Chamber, Industry Division '}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Atilio Savino', 'headline': None}]}]

[{'company': {'id': 18694025, 'name': 'Holland Circular Hotspot', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQFDG5EpZhI-KA/company-logo_400_400/0/1529678847052?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=6fjeJoWfdYSuhgDu2KO7J8STiaNM3uBYRYSiR_hUuuM', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/circularhotspot/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Hoofddorp', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Holland Circular Hotspot', 'description': 'Holland Circular Hotspot: your entrance to the Dutch Circular Economy

The Holland Circular Hotspot (HCH) Foundation was founded in 2018.
The compact and highly efficient HCH-team aims to to create and strengthen Circular Economy (CE) export and investment opportunities for the Dutch business community and stimulate international exchange of CE knowledge and innovation. This is done in close collaboration with the national government and the Netherlands Enterprise Agency (RVO).
By doing so, Dutch knowledge and expertise will contribute to the implementation of circular economy in an international context and help to accelerate the realisation of the UN Sustainable Development Goals.
 
HCH will:
- strengthen the international cooperation between companies, knowledge institutions and governments and invites parties with a similar ambition to work closely together. HCH wil
- increase the international visibility of Dutch knowledge and best practices in the field of Circular Economy
